channel.title: wikipedia on Martin's #rstats blog
channel.description: Recent content in wikipedia on Martin's #rstats blog

item.title: My first post with blogdown
item.description: The data I want to download a table of World War II flying aces from Wikipedia. To do this I will need functions from xml2, rvest, dplyr, stringr, lubridate, and readr. library(xml2) library(rvest) library(tidyverse) Download html page into object in R First I want to store the web url into a string vector in R. wiki_url <- "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_World_War_II_flying_aces" Next I want to use the xml2::read_html() function to read the HTML from the webpage.
